author: draganrakita
content: For EIP-2930, hash data is set as `rlp([1, chainId, nonce, gasPrice, gasLimit, to, value, data, access_list])`, just wanted to check if it stays like this or is maybe going to be changed to something like `1 || rlp([chainId, nonce, gasPrice, gasLimit, to, value, data, access_list])`?

author: sky.cactus
content: <@429719902363058177> EIP was just updated today, it is the latter.

author: sky.cactus
content: So the signed data is the first.  The actual transaction is the latter, but with 3 more parameters (signature).

author: sky.cactus
content: Hmm, you bring up a good point though.  I don't think the EIP specifies how to hash, nor receipt format.

author: draganrakita
content: I am talking about data that is going to be hashes, without signature

author: sky.cactus
content: Once power comes back I'll fill those details in.

author: draganrakita
content: It is this part of EIP `The signing hash would be the hash of the RLP of the entire data structure but popping the last three items representing the signature, and prepending the transaction type: rlp([1, chainId, nonce, gasPrice, gasLimit, to, value, data, access_list]).`

author: sky.cactus
content: Wording could use some love there, along with popping off signature, we also prepend with 1.

author: sky.cactus
content: Hashing for wire transmission and hashing for signature aren't over the same data.

author: sky.cactus
content: Hash for merklization is different from signing hash as well.

author: sky.cactus
content: Once I get power back I'll submit a PR to update the EIP with hashing scheme and receipt scheme.
